channel.title: Data Science on Afrikaniz3D Blogfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science on Afrikaniz3D Blogfolio

item.title: Lobbyists 4 America
item.description:
As part of getting the SQL for Data Science certification, I was required to complete a capstone project. I chose the Lobbyists 4 America project. The project was done on the Community Edition of the Databricks platform. I used both SQL and Python to carry out the exercise.

Below is the full notebook for my project:

Â 
I covered a lot of new areas in this project, including having to use machine learning to work with subjective data. It also gave me some insight into how social media is used to shape thought and perception as well as how some of the strategies employed aren’t as direct/obvious as one would assume. On top of that, it also helps to explain some of the decisions made by social networks (like Twitter) sometimes change how algorithms work and why some of those changes aren’t shared wit the public/creators.

item.title: Maven Hospital Challenge
item.description:
I took part in this year’s Maven Hospital Challenge. I used Databrick’s Community Edition. The exploration was mostly SQL-based. I opted for Databricks over Big Query for the ability to upload large files.

Although I completed the exploration in time I chose to opt out of submitting because I didn’t have a dashboard solution at the time that I was happy with. I’m currently learning Shiny. It suits my set-up and I have a lot of the infrastructure already that makes it easy to work offline when I need to.

item.title: Vibes
item.description:
There was a theme and set of topics set for this month that had to be scrapped,

so this post will touch on some other stuff to keep the monthly train going - and hopefully let off some real steam on the outside.

Got back into reading for the habit more than the learning. I try to do it first thing everyday while it’s still dark. It sets such a good tone for the day.The tone doesn’t last long, but it’s a break. So many things just suck, but the culture says no complaining - good/thankful vibes only.
